summary:
Molluscs are a vast group of animals, including snails, slugs, squid, and octopuses. With over 76,000 known species, they are the second-largest phylum after arthropods. These creatures live in various habitats, from the ocean to freshwater and land.

Key features include a soft body, a mantle for breathing and excretion, and a unique nervous system. They have diverse body shapes, from limpet-like shells to soft, slimy forms. Molluscs have a long history, dating back to the Cambrian period, and they provide many benefits, like food and pearls, but some species can also be harmful to humans and the environment.
title: Mollusca
